  Computer Monitors Now Play a Major Role  The
monitor is one of the most important parts of a computer, yet we don't usually
give it much thought. Instead, many people simply accept whatever is included
in a package deal. But with computers now playing a major role in home
entertainment, business and multimedia, it's time to judge displays on their
own merits. Read computer monitor reviews, compare prices and learn everything
you need to know before you buy.
Also at HowStuffWorks
 
How OLEDs Work -OLEDs are solid-state devices composed of thin films of organic molecules that create light with the application of electricity. 
 Learn how OLEDs can provide brighter, crisper displays on electronic devices while using less power than LEDs or LCDs.   
How Computer Monitors Work  - Because we use them daily, many of us have a lot of questions about our monitors and may not even realize it. What do "aspect ratio" and "refresh rate" mean? What is the difference between 
CRT and LCD? Find out.  
 
How
Spam Works - You block
it, you filter it, you unsubscribe from lists you actually want to be on, and
still it lands in your inbox. If you have an e-mail account, chances are you
also have spam. Learn where spam comes from, who's doing the spamming and how
to stop it.

How to
Add RAM to a Laptop - Random access memory (RAM) is the best-known form of computer memory.
RAM is considered "random access" because you can access any memory
cell directly if you know the row and column that intersect at that cell.
Upgrading your laptop can seem like a daunting task, but it doesn't have to be.
Add RAM to your laptop with the help of this HowStuffWorks video.
